title: [ul] minor improvements to *AeAddr types
body:
- impl `Eq` and `Hash` for `FullAeAddr` and `AeAddr`
- use char for single character pattern matching

title: [dump] Add utility functions dump_object and dump_object_to
body: For dumping a DICOM object with default options without having to create a `DumpOptions`.

title: - fix person_name whitespace trim
body: Building PersonName from slice requires whitespace trimming

title: [core] Fix swapped variant documentation
body: - SV & TM

title: Use snafu report API in CLI tools
body: Version 0.7.2 of `snafu` introduces the Report API, meaning that all the error reporting boilerplate can go away now.

title: [storescp] First implementation of a Store SCP
body: Continued from #209, resolves #206.

title: [transfer-syntax-registry] add TransferSyntaxRegistry::iter
body:
- to iterate over all known transfer syntaxes
- currently not part of the `TransferSyntaxIndex` trait because GATs
- add some test coverage for `TransferSyntaxRegistry`

title: [object] Add getter methods to FileMetaTable
body: For retrieving UIDs

title: [ul] Improve association robustness and expressiveness
body:
- Sanitize transfer syntax and abstract syntax UIDs
- impl `Display` for various reason/source types in `pdu`
- Include association source in association rejection error message
- Add `strict` option for client and server associations
- Add getter method `client_ae_title()` for server associations

title: [ul|object] update implementation UID and version name
body: DICOM-rs 0.5

title: Clippy maintenance
body:
- impl Eq and Hash for some types (not all of them though; see https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/issues/9063 for more info)
- fix check_file use of `then(|| false)`

title: [core] Add tag parsing implementation
body:
- impl `FromStr` for `Tag`
- supports with or without parentheses, fixed length, case insensitive

title: [ul] address module
body:
This is a generalization of #274.

- Add AE address module and data types
- Improve address module
- Rethink AE address
- Add `AeAddr::new_socket_addr`
- Add `TryFrom` impl for `AeAddr<String>`
- Add `ClientAssociationOptions::establish_with`
- [echoscu|storescu] update tools to use `ul::AeAddr`

title: [storescu] safeguard max PDU length check
body: When deciding whether to put everything in a single PDU or in separate PDUs, make a calculation which does not panic if the negotiated maximum PDU length is too low.

title: [object] Make it possible to mutate FileMetaTable in FileDicomObject
body:
- Add new methods to manipulate `FileMetaTable` and refactor some of the implementation
- Add `FileDicomObject::meta_mut`
- Deprecate `InMemDicomObject::meta`

title: [core][parser] Require chrono 0.4.22
body: Evade known vulnerability [RUSTSEC-2020-0159](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2020-0159.html).

title: [object] Update dicom-test-files to v0.2.1
body: This had already been done at `pixeldata`, but it was probably overlooked at `dicom-object`.

title: [ul] Add PDataReader
body:
Resolves #216.

- dual version of PData writer, impls Read to keep receiving PDUs until the last one
- add `receive_pdata` methods in association client and server

title: [storescu] Improve information and feedback provided by CLI
body:
- Require at least on file in input instead of reporting "No supported files to transfer".
- Apply minor tool improvements to output in progress bar and in verbose mode.

title: [echoscu|storescu] Change SCP address parameter to enable specifying AE title
body:
This resolves #204, allowing users to specify the called AE title alongside the socket address with the optional syntax `called-ae-title@socketaddress`. The option `called-ae-title` overrides the AE title in the address with a warning.
README files were updated accordingly.

CC @Almeida-a

title: [pixeldata] Add fuzz tests
body:
This PR introduces fuzz testing to the `pixeldata` crate.

- `decode_image_file` continues the task of opening a DICOM file and also decodes its image data into a vector of pixels.
- `decode_simple_image` constructs a DICOM object by reading image attributes in a non-standard format and inserting them into an empty DICOM object with the transfer syntax Explicit VR Little Endian.

No issues were encountered in my local runs.

title: Change chat platform to Zulip
body:
DICOM-rs is moving away from Gitter and into Zulip for free-form, real-time communication. https://dicom-rs.zulipchat.com

I have already set up this organization with a general stream, a help stream, and a read-only stream with a GitHub activity feed.

If you are unfamiliar with Zulip, see [Getting Started](https://dicom-rs.zulipchat.com/help/getting-started-with-zulip).

title: [dictionary-builder] Update dependencies
body:
- heck 0.4.0
- regex 1.6.0

title: Improve response handling in SCU implementations
body:
- check status code, report them in hexadecimal
- [echoscu] also fix the Message ID check

title: [object] Add a few more iterator-related methods
body:
This extends some of the types in the `object` crate which provide iterators to the contents of the DICOM objects.

This might help to make the object API a bit more ergonomic.

title: Fix assorted clippy lints
body: Affected crates: `core`,  `encoding`, `object`, `ul`, `pixeldata`

title: [pixeldata] Update dev dependencies
body:
- dicom-test-files 0.2.1
- rstest 0.15

title: fallible allocations during object parsing
body:
these checks handle arbitrary length records, failing gracefully if allocation is too high. Also, they enforce that the amount of data read exactly matches the length reported.

the fuzzer in dicom-object is updated with a `fuzz.sh` script that sets the correct ASAN parameters to allow fallible allocations (normally ASAN reports large `malloc`s as an immediate failure)

title: [core] Add items helper
body:
Allows for easy access to sequential data for example when trying
to access data stored in CONTENT_SEQUENCE tags commonly used in
SR files.

title: added PersonName support to Value
body:
Hello Eduardo,
I don't know if this would be useful but I needed to handle Dicom PN.
It only uses borrowed values and family, given names are not optional but mandatory. 

Removed one typo from a previous Doc test

title: [ul] Add safeguard to PDU item length
body:
A P-DATA-TF PDU item length must always be 2 or larger, otherwise the data is malformed. An explicit check on this prevents subtraction overflow which could be caused by malformed external data.

This was detected by the fuzz test harness proposed in #258.

title: [object] Improve file meta information reading routine
body:
- accumulate all bytes read instead of decrementing a counter
   - prevents subtraction overflow by external DICOM input
- change vec allocations by length
   - prevents panicking from OOM caused by malformed DICOM data
- consistently consume value of unexpected or unsupported elements in meta group

Issues identified with the fuzz tests proposed in #258.

title: Cargo fuzz harness
body: Two fuzz targets runnable with [cargo-fuzz](https://github.com/rust-fuzz/cargo-fuzz)

title: [ul] Fix errors in A-ABORT PDU writing
body:
- write `[1, 0]` on _Reserved_ source for consistency
- write code `2` on Source Provider, which was missing

Detected via the fuzz tests in #258. Thanks @evanrichter for reporting inconsistencies here.

title: [parser] Increase reader robustness to stray item end
body:
Resolves #253.

- skip ItemDelimitationItem header when not in a sequence
- improve data set reader validator to account for missing tokens

CC @troelsarvin

title: [pixeldata] Fix third example at crate root
body: Was not using the options.

title: Remove already deprecated dcmdump
body: Should use dicom-dump instead

title: [dump] Fix limit on number of elements dumped
body:
- was constrained to 64 regardless of options
- rewrite value list formatting for efficiency

title: [pixeldata] Optimize colorspace conversion
body: Use `.chunks_mut` instead of `.chunks` from iterator. This optimization was already done in #238, but it can be brought in separately.

title: [pixeldata] Fix normalization LUT + edge cases in vec/ndarray conversion
body:
- Document default behavior in `to_ndarray*` methods
- Fix `Lut::new_rescale_and_normalize`
- Fix interpreting 16bit samples in  `to_vec*` and `to_ndarray*` methods

Should resolve #243 (CC @mike-kfed)

title: Use github-actions/checkout v3
body: Updating checkout action to avoid EOL version of Node.js.

title: [parser] Clean up dataset readers
body:
- remove unused fields and dictionary reference
- tweak constructor function names
- [object] adjust use of parser
- derive Default impl of DataSetReaderOptions

title: [object] Add `element_opt` and `element_by_name_opt`
body: Added some helper methods for working with DICOM objects where it is expected that some attributes might be missing.

title: Logging via tracing
body:
Takes care of #49. Library crates shall use `tracing` to emit events and tools may then use a simple tracing subscriber to print log lines.

This PR also updates some of the crate's error handling constructs.

title: Constrain dependency usage in project
body:
- [dictionary-builder] use ureq instead of reqwest
- narrow Cargo features in image crate (since some image formats are typically not employed here)

title: [pixeldata] pixel data conversion options + LUT transformations

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: Hint that this may require a major version bump on release

body:
This is a major revamp of the `pixeldata` crate so as to support conversions of decoded pixel data with LUT transformations. Resolves #122.

Summary:

- Refactor `adapters::DecodeError` so that now we have a single `Custom` error variant with support for `snafu::whatever!`.
- Move attribute fetching logic to a separate module
- Add new data types for enumerated attributes (`PhotometricInterpretation`, `PlanarConfiguration`, `PixelRepresentation`, `VOILUTFunction`)
- Implement rescale and window level (linear, linear_exact, sigmoid) transformations
- Implement pixel data conversion using a LUT instead of calculating the target value for each pixel value.
- Extend number of frames and frame number as a 32-bit integer.
- Use `f64` for rescale slope and rescale intercept
- Add options for decoded pixel data conversion methods
- Hide fields of `DecodedPixelData`, exposing content via getter methods instead.
- Make this crate's error type opaque
- Add options for `to_vec*` and `to_ndarray*` methods, including LUT construction and application on pixel data values

title: Implement support for multiframe image decoding via gdcm
body:
this is mostly done to test https://github.com/pevers/gdcm-rs/pull/7 for now and maybe get some visibility on how to improve it right away.

Does not crash but for the 2 test files I added it either produces black images or images with 'bad' colors.

title: Use patched version of dicom-test-files
body: This should fix the shakiness of test in this repository until a new version of the `dicom-test-files` is released with robyoung/dicom-test-files#2.

title: Adjust photometric interpretation of decoded pixel data
body: When using native pixel data adapters, the result of decoding should always be in MONOCHROME2 or RGB, regardless of the original encoding. This tweaks `pixeldata` so that certain color space conversions are not performed redundantly.

title: Add rust native decoder for jpeg pixeldata
body:
Provides jpeg decoding for single and multiframe dicoms. Also supports frames distributed onto multiple fragments.

Still to tackle:
- [x] Multiframe images only show up with 'data' on the first frame, rest is empty
- [x] remove untested jpeg encoder settings in tranfer syntax
- [x] change test so it writes pics to dedicated out dir (so there are no clashes between tests)
- [x] make snafu context error on jpeg parsing work
- [x] implement parsing of frames split into multiple fragments
- [x] ~~color offset (lots of green in one test case~~ Might be related to some other issue. not sure that it can be handled in decoder
- [x] ~~Slow in non release mode (maybe some bounds checks?)~~ Should not be fault of jpeg decoder

title: [dump] Tweak output and add "cli" feature flag
body:
- Added `no_limit` flag to API and CLI, which should print the entirety of all data values.
- Removed dash separator when dumping a plain object without file meta group.
- Added `cli` Cargo feature, which slightly reduces some dependencies if disabled.

title: [object] Fix InMemDicomObject::with_meta
body:
- fetch SOP instance UID from the right tag
- add test covering inference of SOP instance UID

title: New crate: dicom-toimage
body:
This is a baseline implementation of a CLI tool for converting DICOM files into image files.
It works fairly well. It exposes the default behavior of `pixeldata`'s conversion `to_image` functionality, while enabling the user to define a few parameters and options. More may come in the future.

title: Find SCU
body:
This is a baseline, proof of concept implementation of a Find SCU.

Resolves #135.
